Key Strengths: Zero cost, instant setup, no server needed, works offline
Key Weaknesses: Inconsistent accuracy across browsers, no customization, privacy concerns (sends to Google/Apple)
Use Case Fit: Perfect fallback when API services fail or for cost-conscious users

Key Strengths: Fastest latency (<400ms), excellent streaming, custom vocabulary support, affordable pricing
Key Weaknesses: Requires stable internet, custom vocabulary requires setup
Use Case Fit: Best for real-time voice commands where latency is critical (<500ms requirement)

Key Strengths: Good accuracy, excellent punctuation, speaker diarization available
Key Weaknesses: Higher latency than Deepgram, more expensive, limited streaming
Use Case Fit: Better for post-processing transcription than real-time commands

Key Strengths: Best accuracy (95%+), handles accents/noise, multilingual (99 languages)
Key Weaknesses: Higher latency (1-2.5s), requires audio file upload, no streaming
Use Case Fit: Best when accuracy is paramount and 1-2s latency is acceptable

Key Strengths: Affordable, good accuracy, robust streaming, integration with GCP
Key Weaknesses: Complex setup (GCP project), overkill for small apps, vendor lock-in
Use Case Fit: Best for enterprise apps already using Google Cloud infrastructure

Key Strengths: Zero cost, instant playback, works offline, no quota limits
Key Weaknesses: Robotic quality, inconsistent voices across browsers, limited control
Use Case Fit: Emergency fallback when all TTS services fail or for demos

Key Strengths: Best-in-class naturalness, emotion control, voice cloning, multilingual
Key Weaknesses: Most expensive option, moderate latency (0.8-1.5s), quota limits
Use Case Fit: Best when voice quality is paramount for production-ready applications

Key Strengths: Affordable, 600+ voices, SSML support, good quality
Key Weaknesses: Quality slightly below ElevenLabs, voice selection complexity
Use Case Fit: Best balance of cost and quality for budget-conscious production apps

Key Strengths: Low latency (<800ms), real-time streaming, voice cloning, emotional control
Key Weaknesses: Smaller voice library than competitors, moderate pricing
Use Case Fit: Best for low-latency applications where <1s response time is critical

Key Strengths: Most affordable, 380+ voices, WaveNet quality, GCP integration
Key Weaknesses: Neural2 voices average quality, complex setup, no streaming
Use Case Fit: Best for enterprise apps already using GCP with cost constraints

Key Strengths: Fastest total round-trip (<2.5s avg), both support streaming, good accuracy
Key Weaknesses: Higher combined cost, requires 2 API integrations
Use Case Fit: Best for real-time conversational UI where <3s round-trip is mandatory

Custom Vocabulary: Whisper handles context, ElevenLabs voice cloning
Key Strengths: Best accuracy + best quality, excellent for accents/noise, professional output
Key Weaknesses: Highest latency (2-4s), most expensive, Whisper doesn't stream
Use Case Fit: Best for polished production apps where quality > speed

Key Strengths: Affordable, fast (<3s avg), both stream, 600+ voice options
Key Weaknesses: Quality slightly below ElevenLabs, moderate setup complexity
Use Case Fit: Best balance of speed, cost, and quality for most production apps

Technology: Web Speech API + Web Speech TTS
Key Strengths: Zero cost, instant setup, works offline, no quota limits, no API keys
Key Weaknesses: Inconsistent quality, browser-dependent accuracy, robotic voices
Use Case Fit: Perfect fallback for when all APIs fail or for free demos

Key Strengths: Best accuracy, affordable TTS, good voice selection, simple setup
Use Case Fit: Best for apps prioritizing accuracy with budget constraints
